The total surface area of a cube is calculated by finding the area of one side and then multiplying that by 6 (since a cube has 6 sides). The area of one side of a cube is calculated by squaring the length of one side. So, the total surface area of a cube with a side length of 5 cm is 6 * (5 cm)² = 150 cm².

The force on a 1 kg mass due to the gravitational force is approximately 9.8 Newtons. This value is calculated using the formula F = m * g, where m is the mass (1 kg in this case) and g is the acceleration due to gravity (approximately 9.8 m/s²).

One example of a cultural practice is the Chinese New Year celebration. During this time, families clean their homes, decorate with red lanterns and couplets, prepare special meals, and exchange red envelopes filled with money (hongbao) as a sign of good luck and prosperity. The Chinese New Year is also marked by the zodiac animal of the year, and people born in that year are believed to have certain characteristics associated with that animal. This tradition is deeply rooted in Chinese culture and is celebrated by millions of people around the world.

Two types of desert biomes are the hot desert and the cold desert. Hot deserts, also known as arid deserts, are characterized by extreme temperatures, little rainfall, and scarce vegetation. Cold deserts, also known as polar deserts, are characterized by extremely low temperatures, little precipitation, and sparse vegetation. Examples of hot deserts include the Sahara Desert and the Mojave Desert, while examples of cold deserts include the Antarctic Desert and the Arctic Desert.
